roleset.name: break, violate, cause to not be whole

roles.note: differs from verb (break.01) frame in the presence of Arg4, which could have been useful and prevented new roleset, break.16. No examples found of instrument, but certainly seems possible.

example.name: NP only, Args 0 & 4.
example.text: his apparent break with his old mentor , Mr. Honecker
example.arg: with his old mentor , Mr. Honecker

example.name: Arg 4 only
example.text: By making a break from tradition , Brooks Brothers is seeking adelicate balance .

example.name: Arg1 & TMP
example.text: The crash victim suffered multiple breaks to the ribs and the left femur.
example.arg: to the ribs and the left femur
example.note: "Multiple" indicates frequency, thus is tagged as TMP.

example.name: Arg 1 as possessor
example.text: The dam's break was probably caused by defective materials.

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: Also if she does go and take me to small claims, could I counter sue for loss wages due to her break of the verbal contract?

example.name: With Arg 3
example.text: This causes a break of ozone molecules into radicals in the period of polar sunrises.

roleset.note: Roleset based on verb break.01, OntoNotes grouping break-n senses 3, 6, 9, 10; Maps to VN classes break-45.1, hurt-40.8.3-1-1, split-23.2. Framed by Claire.

roleset.name: to suspend an action, take a break from something, musical interlude

role.descr: Person taking/causing break, causer of interruption

example.name: Arg2 only
example.text: The program was aired in its entirety without commercial breaks.

example.name: NP only, Arg1 & TMP
example.text: a midweek break from their recent wild gyrations
These breaks of concentration from all the interruptions won't help me finish the work on time.

example.name: Arg1 & TMP
example.text: We made a dash for the car during a brief break in the rainstorm.

example.name: Arg2, musical domain
example.text: It's a very difficult break for solo flute.

roleset.note: Roleset based on OntoNotes grouping break-n senses 1 & 11; no equivalent PB verb, no relevant mapping to VN. Framed by Claire.

roleset.name: Break into motion, for a goal or from a source location

roles.note: No example found of all arguments co-occuring.

example.name: Arg2 only
example.text: At recess the children made a break for the playground.

example.name: Arg1
example.text: It was the largest break from a federal prison in decades.

example.name: Arg1 in pre-relational position
example.text: The man has made several jail breaks but was always recaptured.

example.name: Args 0 & 2
example.text: Nirupama, a bright young journalist, had made her break for freedom from the prison walls of home and feudal society.
example.arg: for freedom from the prison walls of home and feudal society.
example.note: "from the prison walls..." argument should be a modifier of "freedom" rather than break, thus it is not tagged as an arg1 here.

roleset.note: Roleset based on OntoNotes grouping break-n senses 7 & 8; no equivalent PB verb, no relevant mapping to VN. Framed by Claire.

roleset.name: notable occurance; point at which one's luck turns (bad break, lucky break, etc)

example.name: With arg1
example.text: There has been the first break in the case

example.name: with arg0
example.text: ... KHS Musical Company used to organize an annual campus rock band competition where many singers and bands got their first big break , including Chang Yu - sheng , Tai Cheng - hsiao , and The Orient Express .

example.name: luck changes for the worse
example.text: Herbert's bad break in heavy Bradford Bulls defeat

roleset.note: Added by Julia base on more-nouns, OntoNotes sense 5. No VNcls.

roleset.name: onset, beginning

example.name: corpus example
example.text: Come day break , I 'll be here by your side

example.name: break of dawn
example.text: I waited until the break of dawn.

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. Corresponds to VNcls appear-48.1.1.

role.descr: Thing achieved, gotten, or barrier broken through

roleset.name: breaking and entering

example.name: particle + preposition; both args
example.text: Ginny smiled; she remembered Harry telling her about his break-in into the Lestrange vault.

example.name: standard corpus example
example.text: the Cabinet will convene , the Council of Ministers , and demand ah and we give authorization to the Lebanese army to perform break - ins

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. No VNcls.

roleset.name: separate one thing from others (completive)

example.name: Corpus example
example.text: Mr. Andersson insists that Trelleborg and Noranda have n't discussed a Falconbridge break - up .

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: The housemate was crying over his break-up with on-off girlfriend Sammi.
example.note: *in this type of usage, it is usually impossible to know who did the breaking up. Use args 1 and 2.

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: On December 12, 1933 Connie Mack continued his break up of the A's by sending Max, Lefty Grove and George Walberg to the Boston Red Sox for $125000

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. Corresponds to VNcls break-45.1.
